image.altText: A man with dark hair and glasses in a suit.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court orders mediation for former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann over funding he says he was offered to pay for his lawyers.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann ordered into mediation over funds for lawyers

image.altText: A woman up on a stage speaking into a microphone with a smile.

props.synopsis: The High Court has backed a decision by the government to refuse a temporary visa to American commentator Candace Owens Farmer, who had planned a speaking tour to Australia in 2024.

title.children: Australian court upholds decision to block visa for Candace Owens

image.altText: An infrared camera pointed at Return to Glenrowan by Sidney Nolan from his Ned Kelly Collection.

props.synopsis: Hidden figures and inscriptions are being discovered beneath some of Australia's most famous paintings as conservators use infrared technology to reveal details in Sidney Nolan's Ned Kelly series, unseen since the artist's own time.

title.children: Forensic imaging reveals hidden layers under Ned Kelly paintings

image.altText: Man in suit and sunglasses beside a woman in a suit jacket and pink shirt wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors call for a jail term to be imposed over the theft of more than $300,000 from a Canberra child care centre by its then-director Emma Louise Morton.

title.children: Former child care director who defrauded $300,000 from centre faces court

image.altText: Smiling dark-haired Brittany in a dark blazer walks down a street, 7 news mic thrust in front, Sharaz walks beside.

props.synopsis: Former senator Linda Reynolds files a creditor's petition in the Federal Court against her ex-staffer, Brittany Higgins, as she tries to recover damages awarded to her for defamation.

title.children: Higgins faces bankruptcy proceedings as Reynolds takes new legal action

image.altText: Victoria Engel wearing glasses, a yellow shirt and dark jacket.

props.synopsis: The ACT Director of Public Prosecutions says her office does not have enough funding to deal with an increasing annual caseload of more than 23,000 charges.

title.children: ACT top prosecutor says they might have to start turning away cases

image.altText: Sue Webeck of the Domestic Violence Crisis Service

props.synopsis: A levy meant to improve support for victims of family violence in the ACT has come under scrutiny in an inquiry, which has heard concerns about how funds are managed.

title.children: Domestic violence levy review hears victims waiting days for help

image.altText: The exterior of a white marble building with a sign reading "Law Court of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: Prosecutors have called for the man to be jailed for a significant period of time after he was found guilty of raping two women by an ACT Supreme Court jury.

title.children: Victim tells court rapist 'chose, repeatedly, to cause immense harm'

image.altText: A young boy holds a knitted toy octopus.

props.synopsis: More than 6,000 gifts are made each year by the charity Good Omen Goodeze. For patients like Zyan, these knitted toys are more than fun — they’re therapeutic.

title.children: When 4yo Zyan was in pain, a blue knitted octopus kept him calm

image.altText: Stephen Flelli sits at a table with a drink in his hand.

props.synopsis: After vanishing without a trace, this restaurateur reappeared a year later spruiking a shiny new investment opportunity. But there's just one problem.

title.children: Chef who vanished caught selling lettuce hundreds of kilometres away

image.altText: Close up of man in white shirt and dark glasses (Darren Woolley).

props.synopsis: Darren Woolley spent years sharing his expert knowledge of marketing on the web for free. Almost overnight, the world mostly stopped listening to businesses like his.

title.children: 'It's pretty brutal': Inside the businesses being strangled by AI search

image.altText: Aboriginal flag at Parramatta deaths in custody rally

props.synopsis: NSW Coroner Teresa O'Sullivan's rare public comment on the "entrenched over-representation" of Indigenous prisoners as the state records the most ever in a single year, is welcomed by the grieving family member of a man who died in prison.

title.children: Rare statement recognises 'inhumane treatment of First Nations people in jail'

image.altText: Jane Hume corridor doorstop

props.synopsis: Liberal senator Jane Hume has cautioned against a Liberal Party split, arguing it would result in the party falling behind One Nation in the polls. Follow live.

title.children: Hume backs warnings against Liberal Party split

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ley throws support behind Paterson's speech
Ley says she won't get in 'war of words' with Victorian premier over crime
'No point in being second most popular': Hume warns against Lib split

image.altText: United States captain Chris Richards confronts the referee on the pitch as a group of Socceroo players stand by.

props.synopsis: The Socceroos are looking for an eighth-straight victory as they take on the United States in Colorado as the road to the 2026 FIFA World Cup continues. Follow live.

title.children: Tempers flare in Denver as USA leads Socceroos

image.altText: Zach Merrett looks to his left after the Bombers lost to the Swans.

props.synopsis: Deadline day of the AFL trade period has arrived, with clubs racing the clock to complete deals today. Does Zach Merrett get to Hawthorn, or Charlie Curnow to Sydney? Find out live.

title.children: Merrett and Curnow mega-deals in the balance on AFL trade deadline day

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: One hour until trading officially opens
Every deal in the balance on deadline day
Essendon reportedly keen on Cam Mackenzie in Merrett deal

image.altText: A flames engulf a house in a residential area.

props.synopsis: Police say it will take some time to establish the identities of the people who have died and what caused the blaze.

title.children: Three confirmed dead in 'horrific' Queensland house fire

image.altText: A red petrol station sign shows prices for ULP at 229.9 cents per litre, sunset in the distance

props.synopsis: Industry experts say there is no excuse for wild variations in fuel prices across Australia, as calls grow for an independent investigation into the disparity.

title.children: Broome drivers are paying $2.29 per litre. Down the road it's a different story

image.altText: Flames coming from roof of ornate two-storey building with firehoses spraying water on fire.

props.synopsis: Two men are being questioned by police after fire destroyed a historical building in Lismore, only recently restored after the devastating 2022 floods.

title.children: Two men arrested after fire destroys 'landmark' masonic building

image.altText: People wave the Madagascar flag from a pickup truck driving through a crowd.

props.synopsis: The country's parliament voted to impeach President Andry Rajoelina after he fled the country in the face of growing opposition from soldiers and police.

title.children: Military announces takeover of Madagascar after president flees

image.altText: A multi-legged, black drone mid-flight in front of a blurry helicopter silhouette

props.synopsis: Peaceful European NATO nations that support Ukraine are repeatedly being targeted by mysterious drone incursions, and experts say dozens in the past month appear to have links to Russia.

title.children: Experts say Russia is 'already waging a NATO drone war'. These maps show how

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to media during a press conference.

props.synopsis: After two years of refusing to reshape his superannuation shake-up, the treasurer abandons the idea of taxing unrealised gains while agreeing to index a key tax threshold.

title.children: Was Chalmers taught a lesson in his fight over superannuation?

image.altText: People's hands holding phones in front of a colourful social media logo.

props.synopsis: Teenagers on Instagram will be restricted to seeing PG-13 content by default and won't be able to change their settings without a parent's permission, Meta has announced.

title.children: Instagram to limit teens to PG-13 content, Meta says

image.altText: A screenshot of a black and white image of blazing boat on an ocean with the word 'unclassified' above it

props.synopsis: It is the fifth deadly strike in the Caribbean amid the Trump administration's crackdown on alleged drug traffickers.

title.children: US strike on alleged drug boat off Venezuela kills six, Trump says

image.altText: a woman looks at the camera whilst holding her mobile phone

props.synopsis: Parents and carers are frustrated by what they say is a lack of support when trying to report several Instagram accounts targeting children under the age of 17 over the school holidays.

title.children: Parents of children targeted by 'nasty' cyberbullying feel 'helpless'

image.altText: Sam Groth and his wife Brittany, who is smiling, at an election party

props.synopsis: The Herald Sun newspaper has defended its reporting about deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party Sam Groth and his wife as it prepares for a defamation lawsuit in the Federal Court.

title.children: Herald Sun says stories about Liberal MP Sam Groth and wife were in 'public interest'

image.altText: Gold and silver tokens resembling coins and bearing the Bitcoin logo.

props.synopsis: A Chinese national accused of being the mastermind behind one of the largest ever investment frauds has been charged in the US.

title.children: US seizes billions in bitcoin linked to 'massive' alleged scam

image.altText: A woman standing outside a police station, wearing a stern expression.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has doubled down on its stance against detaining transgender women in female prisons, as a local LGBTQIA+ group says it is "horrified" by the comments.

title.children: Advocates condemn NT leader's comments on trans women in female prisons

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has risen sharply despite a volatile session on Wall Street that has ended mostly lower. It follows Donald Trump ramping up trade tensions by saying he will consider "terminating business with China having to do with cooking oil". Follow live.

title.children: ASX jumps and Trump's latest threat against China sends Wall St lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Telix Pharmaceuticals and Bank of Queensland among the best-performing ASX stocks

image.altText: A caterpillar's head against a black backdrop.

props.synopsis: An Australian photographer who took a unique shot of a skeletoniser caterpillar is among the winners.

title.children: Stunning snaps on show as Wildlife Photographer of the Year winners named

image.altText: Drone shot of eleven fuel tanks next to harbour

props.synopsis: Groundwater is leaking through the safety liner under some of the fuel facility's 11 tanks, which were constructed unlawfully on Darwin Harbour without a building permit. It comes after the NT government approved the tanks for operation in September.

title.children: Safety liner under US military fuel tanks still failing, weeks after approval

image.altText: A man in a dark, broad-brimmed hat sings into a microphone.

props.synopsis: The Untitled (How Does It Feel) singer died after a long struggle with cancer, his family said.

title.children: Grammy-winning R&B singer D'Angelo dies aged 51

image.altText: Pauline Hanson sipping from a beer at the launch party. An Australian flag hanging in the background.

props.synopsis: Polling has support for One Nation somewhere between 10 and 14 per cent, much higher than during the federal election.

title.children: Why has support for One Nation surged since the election, and will it last?

image.altText: A woman in a black dress stands next to Donald Trump in front of a row of US flags.

props.synopsis: The public killing of the conservative figure rocked the US. Now Donald Trump has awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Charlie Kirk at a White House ceremony.

title.children: Trump posthumously awards top civilian honour to Charlie Kirk

image.altText: Three  prosthetic fingerstips worn on a hand showing a colour mismatch.

props.synopsis: A prosthetics provider has left Australians thousands of dollars out of pocket, some having to cope with ill-fitting or wrong-coloured fingers and eyes.

title.children: 'Like out of a show bag': Prosthetic clients struggle to get refunds
